p: Cardiovascular disease is a challenging disease with high morbidity and mortality worldwide ( 1). Myocardial ischemia/reperfusion (MI/R) injury is the primary risk factor in the pathological process of heart disease. Although reperfusion is the most efficient way to mimic tissue damage, the re-establishment of the blood supply is known to induce various adverse events ( 2). In addition, MI/R also induces endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress and activates apoptosis-related signaling pathways ( 3).
